title: Understanding Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma -- Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: Symptoms of Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
content: Symptoms of non- Hodgkin lymphoma may include:
The symptoms of fever, heavy night sweats, and weight loss are known as "B" symptoms. They are most often associated with more aggressive disease.
bullets: Painless swelling of one or more lymph nodes, with no recent infection. Swelling may be intermittent.
Swelling, fluid accumulation, or pain in the abdomen .
Shortness of breath, wheezing , or coughing .
Bloody stool or vomit.
Swelling of the face, neck, and arms.
Blockage of urine flow.
Bone pain.
Unexplained weight loss amounting to 10% of body weight over six months.
Fever lasting for at least 14 consecutive days, usually in the late afternoon and early evening, and rarely above 102 degrees.
Headache.
Seizures .
Visual problems.
Mental status changes.
Numbness on areas of the face.
Balance problems.
Night sweats and chills lasting at least 14 consecutive days.
Severe itching of the skin .
Fatigue .
Weakness .

content_blocks.text: Symptoms of non- Hodgkin lymphoma may include:
associated_bullets: Painless swelling of one or more lymph nodes, with no recent infection. Swelling may be intermittent.
Swelling, fluid accumulation, or pain in the abdomen .
Shortness of breath, wheezing , or coughing .
Swelling of the face, neck, and arms.
Unexplained weight loss amounting to 10% of body weight over six months.
Fever lasting for at least 14 consecutive days, usually in the late afternoon and early evening, and rarely above 102 degrees.
Numbness on areas of the face.
Night sweats and chills lasting at least 14 consecutive days.

content_blocks.text: The symptoms of fever, heavy night sweats, and weight loss are known as "B" symptoms. They are most often associated with more aggressive disease.

sections.heading: Call Your Doctor If:
bullets: You notice a swollen, painless lymph node.
You have unexplained abdominal pain or swelling.
You develop an unexplained cough , shortness of breath, or wheezing.
You develop swelling of the face, neck, or arms.
You have unintended weight loss, fever, severe fatigue, or soaking night sweats lasting more than two weeks.
You have unexplainable, severe itching of your skin.
You have changes in mental activity.

items: You notice a swollen, painless lymph node.
You have unexplained abdominal pain or swelling.
You develop an unexplained cough , shortness of breath, or wheezing.
You develop swelling of the face, neck, or arms.
You have unintended weight loss, fever, severe fatigue, or soaking night sweats lasting more than two weeks.
You have unexplainable, severe itching of your skin.
You have changes in mental activity.

meta_description: A list of the possible signs and symptoms of non-Hodgkin lymphoma from WebMD.
